messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Live chats (for fast typists, or fast readers)
messages.msgSnippet: -=Are the chats readable afterwards as transcripts ?-=- The Monday and Friday chats are just to talk, no particular subject. Many of the topic chats are edited
messages.messageBody:
-=Are the chats readable afterwards as transcripts ?-=-

The Monday and Friday chats are just to talk, no particular subject.
Many of the topic chats are edited and put up to read. Those are
linked at the bottom of
http://sandradodd.com/chat

And there are a couple I still need to do.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Live chats (for fast typists, or fast readers)
messages.msgSnippet: Yes. Here s the link. Sandra gets them up as soon as she can. http://sandradodd.com/chat You can join the ChatNote group from the site. Sandra will often
messages.messageBody:
Yes. Here's the link. Sandra gets them up as soon as she can.

http://sandradodd.com/chat

You can join the ChatNote group from the site. Sandra will often
announce there that transcripts are up for previous chats.

Robin B.

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Live chats (for fast typists, or fast readers)
messages.msgSnippet: Are the chats readable afterwards as transcripts ?I love those chats... They are treats for the day to day inspiration boost. Anne To:
messages.messageBody:
Are the chats readable afterwards as transcripts ?I love those chats...
They are treats for the day to day inspiration boost.

Anne






To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
From: Sandra@...
Date: Mon, 30 Mar 2009 09:39:26 -0600
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Live chats (for fast typists, or fast readers)





















-=and the other clock should be set to the viewer's time

zone. <<<<



It never is filled in for my time zone when I click on over. All I do is

click on the drop down list and choose my time zone and that's when it

gives

me the time for the chat in my time zone.-=-



Right.

The other clock should be set by the view to the viewer's time zone.



I think it's possible to register so that when you go in it has saved

your time zone.



Sandra

messages.messageBody:
-=and the other clock should be set to the viewer's time
zone. <<<<

It never is filled in for my time zone when I click on over. All I do is
click on the drop down list and choose my time zone and that's when it
gives
me the time for the chat in my time zone.-=-

Right.
The other clock should be set by the view to the viewer's time zone.

I think it's possible to register so that when you go in it has saved
your time zone.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Live chats (for fast typists, or fast readers)
messages.msgSnippet: ... date already), and the other clock should be set to the viewer s time zone.
messages.messageBody:
>>>> The top clock will be my time (and it's filled in with the hour and
date already), and the other clock should be set to the viewer's time
zone. <<<<

It never is filled in for my time zone when I click on over. All I do is
click on the drop down list and choose my time zone and that's when it gives
me the time for the chat in my time zone.

~Katherine

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Live chats (for fast typists, or fast readers)
messages.msgSnippet: -=-I keep seeing the reminders and click on the links, but there are no times mentioned in either place-=- On the monday/friday page, isn t there a big
messages.messageBody:
-=-I keep seeing the reminders and click on the links, but there are
no times
mentioned in either place-=-

On the monday/friday page, isn't there a big explanation of how to use
the time clock? And isn't there a countdown on each page?

http://sandradodd.com/chats/normal

If you click on the clock with the question mark on it, that goes to
an exact time with translation to any time zone.
There are notes in a yellow box above that, because some people have
had a hard time figuring out to click on it, or how to use it when
they're in there.

The top clock will be my time (and it's filled in with the hour and
date already), and the other clock should be set to the viewer's time
zone.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Live chats (for fast typists, or fast readers)
messages.msgSnippet: Tomorrow/Monday afternoon March 30 Wednesday afternoon, April 1 Friday morning, April 3 Both days, chats on unschooling.   For the exact time in your time
messages.messageBody:
Tomorrow/Monday afternoon March 30

Wednesday afternoon, April 1

Friday morning, April 3


Both days, chats on unschooling. For the exact time in your time
zone, go to the link for the chat below.

I don't always announce them here. If you want regular reminders,
join the chat list that's linked from those pages (click the chat icon
at the bottom of any of the pages).

http://sandradodd.com/chats/regular

http://sandradodd.com/chats/being

That second link, the Wednesday chat, is on the topic of *how* to be
with a child, spend more time with a child, have a good relationship
with a child.

"For parents who feel most comfortable alone or who haven't had much
to do with other than their own children thus far, unschooling
requires a different kind of relationship and more involvement. Here's
a chat on connecting more with our children, and creating a strong
bond after infancy when the relationship changes and children's needs
expand more and more into a wider world.
"Having more ways to tap into unschooling success can mean avoidance
of school, and most important, avoidance of developing a distance
between parents and children. So if you can share ways of relating
better with your children or if you're a person who wants to know
more, come help in this chat if you have time."

Sandra
